com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenNoteDoc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenNoteDoc

  • public class SpenNoteDoc
extends Object
    NoteDoc class This class provides the functionality for managing the data of an SPD file and provides methods for loading and saving the file, adding and removing PageDocs from NoteDocs, and attaching external files.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           int width,
           int height)
            throws IOException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general.
        height - The PageDoc height in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView height in general.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a cache directory fails to be generated.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           int orientation,
           int width,
           int height)
            throws IOException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified orientation.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        orientation - The orientation mode for the NoteDoc instance. The valid values are: ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE For more information, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general.
        height - The PageDoc height in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView height in general.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory fails to be generated.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the orientation is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           int width,
           int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly.
        mode - SpenNoteDoc mode. The valid values are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is passed.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the file requires a password.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           double rotation,
           int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified rotation, file and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. Use a double for rotation and not an integer to avoid confusion with the width parameter.
        SpenNoteDoc note = new SpenNoteDoc(context, filePath, (double)rotation);
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        rotation - The rotation value for the note, page and objects. Use a double that is divisible by 90.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. The valid modes are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more information, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the file requires a password.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the rotation parameter is not a double that is divisible by 90.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           String password,
           int width,
           int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general.
        mode - The mode for SpenNoteDoc. The valid values are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the password passed is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           String password,
           double rotation,
           int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, rotation and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA. Use a double for rotation and not an integer to avoid confusion with the width parameter.
        SpenNoteDoc note = new SpenNoteDoc(context, filePath, password, (double)rotation);
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        rotation - The rotation for the note, page and objects. Use a double type that is divisible by 90.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. The valid values are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the password passed is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the rotation parameter is not a double that is divisible by 90.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           int width,
           int mode,
           boolean discardUnsavedData)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, read/write mode and cache handling mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and a user opens an SPD file, the attributes of the objects for a page such as, line width, and border change accordingly.
        mode - The mode for SpenNoteDoc. The valid values are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        discardUnsavedData - Set to true to ignore the files in the internal cache directory and use new files, set to false to use the files in the internal cache directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - If a file requires a password.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
           String filePath,
           String password,
           int width,
           int mode,
           boolean discardUnsavedData)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, read/write mode and cache handling mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the dimensions (width X height) exceed the screen, the dimensions are resized and maximized. If the resolution of the display is larger than WQXGA, it is limited to WQXGA.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and a user opens an SPD file, the attributes of the objects for a page such as, line width, and border change accordingly.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. The valid values are MODE_READ_ONLY and MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        discardUnsavedData - Set to true to ignore the files in the internal cache directory and use new files, set to false to use the files in the internal cache directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the cache directory is not generated or its files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - If an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - If the password is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width/height ratio is less than 3 to 2.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

    • Method Detail

      • discard

        public void discard()
             throws IOException
        Discard the NoteDoc instance.
        This method deletes the new data before closing the NoteDoc. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        See Also:
        close()

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the note document.
        This method deletes all the data of a NoteDoc before closing it. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        See Also:
        discard()

      • appendPage

        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.

      • appendPage

        public SpenPageDoc appendPage(int backgroundColor,
                     String backgroundImagePath,
                     int backgourndImageMode)
        Add a new page with the specified background color and background image.
        Parameters:
        backgroundColor - The background color for the page.
        backgroundImagePath - The absolute path of the background image file.
        backgourndImageMode - The background image mode for the page. The valid value is: SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER For more information, see Field Detail in the SpenPageDoc class reference.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        See Also:
        SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER

      • insertPage

        Insert a new page at the index.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index passed is out of range.
        See Also:
        SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER

      • insertPage

        public SpenPageDoc insertPage(int pageIndex,
                     int backgroundColor,
                     String backgroundImagePath,
                     int backgourndImageMode)
        Insert a new page at the specified index with the specified background color and background image.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - The page index.
        backgroundColor - The background color for the page.
        backgroundImagePath - The absolute path of the background image file.
        backgourndImageMode - The background image mode for the page. The valid value is: SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER For more information, see Field Detail in the SpenPageDoc class reference.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index passed is out of range.

      • appendTemplatePage

        public SpenPageDoc appendTemplatePage(String templatePath)
                               throws IOException,
                                      SpenUnsupportedTypeException
        Add the specified template.
        Use either the file path or the asset URI for templatePath. If the orientation of the template page does not match the NoteDoc, it is not appended.
        Parameters:
        templatePath - The absolute path of the template file or the Android asset URI of the template. Use either the absolute path of the file or the asset URI for templatePath.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the directory of the file or the asset URI does not exist.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if the template orientation does not match the NoteDoc orientation.

      • insertTemplatePage

        public SpenPageDoc insertTemplatePage(int pageIndex,
                             String templatePath)
                               throws IOException,
                                      SpenUnsupportedTypeException
        Insert the specified template page at the specified index.
        If the orientation of the template page does not match the NoteDoc, it is not appended.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - The page index.
        templatePath - The absolute path of the template file or the Android asset URI of the template. Use either the absolute path of the file or the asset URI for templatePath.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the directory of the file or the asset URI does not exist.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if the template orientation does not match the NoteDoc orientation.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index passed is out of range.

      • movePageIndex

        public void movePageIndex(SpenPageDoc page,
                 int step)
        Move the index of the specified page by the specified step.
        Moves the page forward or backward by the step. If page index is 3 and the step is 2, the page moves to page 5. If the step is -1, it moves to page 2.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to be moved.
        step - The number of pages to move forward or backward. If page index is 3 and the step is 2, the page moves to page 5. If the step is -1, it moves to page 2.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the page passed is null.

      • getPageIdByIndex

        public String getPageIdByIndex(int pageIndex)

        Parameters:
        pageIndex - The page index.
        Returns:
        The page ID.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index is out of range.

      • attachFile

        public void attachFile(String key,
              String filePath)
        Attach the specified file to the note with the specified key.
        If a redundant key with a different file path is attached, the existing attachment is replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the file.
        filePath - The absolute path of the file.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the key passed is invalid or the file path is redundant or null.

      • detachFile

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the key passed is invalid.
        See Also:
        attachFile(String,String)

        Parameters:
